citation.article-title: Thauera selenatis gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the beta subclass of Proteobacteria with a novel type of anaerobic respiration.

p.s: Description of Thauera selenatis sp. nov.
Thauera selenatis (se.le.na'tis. N.L. chem. term selenas, selenate; N.L. gen. n. selenatis, of selenate, because the organism reduces selenate to selenite)
In addition to the characteristics given above in the genus description, T. selenatis has the characteristics described below.
Colonies on defined medium containing acetate are 0.75 mm in diameter after 5 days of aerobic growth at 28°C.
On agar supplemented with 0.4% yeast extract colonies are 1.1 mm in diameter after 3 days.
Growth occurs at 4°C but not at 39°C.
Does not hydrolyze gelatin or starch.
The DNA base composition of the type strain is 66 mol% G+C (as determined by the thermal denaturation method).
Other characteristics are shown in Tables 2 and 3.
The type strain is strain AX (= ATCC 55363), which was isolated from selenium-contaminated drainage water in the San Joaquin Valley of California.
